content:
IReliableQueue<T> IReliableQueue(Of T) Interface

Definition

Namespace:
Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.Collections
Assembly:
Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.Interfaces.dll

Represents a reliable first-in, first-out collection of objects that are persisted and replicated.

Edit

In this Article

public interface IReliableQueue<T> : IReliableCollection<T>, IReliableStatePublic Interface IReliableQueue(Of T)
    Inherits IReliableCollection(Of T)

Type Parameters

T

The type of the elements contained in the reliable queue.

Inherited Members

Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.Collections.IReliableCollection{{T}}

GetCountAsync(ITransaction)GetCountAsync(ITransaction)
ClearAsync()ClearAsync()

Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.IReliableState

NameName

Remarks

Values stored in this queue MUST NOT be mutated outside the context of an operation on the queue. It is highly recommended to make T immutable in order to avoid accidental data corruption.

Transaction is the unit of concurrency: Users can have multiple transactions in-flight at any given point of time but for a given transaction each API must be called one at a time. So all Reliable Collection APIs that take in a transaction and return a Task, must be awaited one at a time. ITransaction

IEnumerable that represents all the values.

Exceptions
FabricNotReadableException FabricNotReadableException

Exception indicates that the cannot serve reads at the moment. can be thrown in all s. One example for it being thrown in the is loss of . One example for it being thrown in the is that Reliable Queue's state is not yet consistent.

EnqueueAsync(ITransaction, T) EnqueueAsync(ITransaction, T)

Edit

Adds an object to the end of the reliable queue.

Task EnqueueAsync(ITransaction tx, T item)Function EnqueueAsync(tx As ITransaction, item As T) As Task
Parameters
tx
ITransaction ITransaction

Transaction to associate this operation with.

item
T T

The object to add to the end of the queue. The value can be null for reference types.

Returns
Task Task

Task that represents the asynchronous enqueue operation.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException ArgumentNullException

tx is null.

TimeoutException TimeoutException

The operation failed to complete within the default timeout.

FabricNotPrimaryException FabricNotPrimaryException

The exception that is thrown when the is not in .

InvalidOperationException InvalidOperationException

The exception that is thrown when a method call is invalid for the object's current state. Example, transaction used is already terminated: comitted or aborted.

EnqueueAsync(ITransaction, T, TimeSpan, CancellationToken) EnqueueAsync(ITransaction, T, TimeSpan, CancellationToken)

Edit

Adds an object to the end of the reliable queue.

Task EnqueueAsync(ITransaction tx, T item, TimeSpan timeout, CancellationToken cancellationToken)Function EnqueueAsync(tx As ITransaction, item As T, timeout As TimeSpan, cancellationToken As CancellationToken) As Task
Parameters
tx
ITransaction ITransaction

Transaction to associate this operation with.

item
T T

The object to add to the end of the queue. The value can be null for reference types.

timeout
TimeSpan TimeSpan

The amount of time to wait for the operation to complete before throwing a TimeoutException. Primarily used to prevent deadlocks. The default is 4 seconds.

cancellationToken
CancellationToken CancellationToken

The token to monitor for cancellation requests. The default is None.

Returns
Task Task

Task that represents the asynchronous enqueue operation.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException ArgumentNullException

tx is null.

ArgumentException ArgumentException

timeout is negative.

TimeoutException TimeoutException

The operation failed to complete within the given timeout.

OperationCanceledException OperationCanceledException

The operation was canceled.

FabricNotPrimaryException FabricNotPrimaryException

The exception that is thrown when the is not in .

InvalidOperationException InvalidOperationException

The exception that is thrown when a method call is invalid for the object's current state. Example, transaction used is already terminated: comitted or aborted.
